medical_history.chief_complaint: Self-mutilation behaviors related to congenital tethered spinal cord.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms of severe radicular chest and back pain began at age 12, associated with self-mutilation of fingers, leading to autoamputation of finger tips. Pain resolved after a detethering procedure, but symptoms recurred two years later with a second detethering procedure. With each procedure, self-mutilation behavior ceased temporarily.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Born with myelomeningocele, developed hydrocephalus, underwent ventriculoperitoneal shunt placement, has a left pelvic kidney, neurogenic bladder, and scoliosis. History of recurring radicular pain and self-mutilation behaviors.
medical_history.social_history: Wheelchair bound, attends mainstream school with passing grades, no history of neuropsychological disturbances.
